Detailed Description

osc_extent data to manage dirty pages.

osc_extent has the following attributes: 1. all pages in the same must be in one RPC in write back; 2. # of pages must be less than max_pages_per_rpc - implied by 1; 3. must be covered by only 1 osc_lock; 4. exclusive. It's impossible to have overlapped osc_extent.

The lifetime of an extent is from when the 1st page is dirtied to when all pages inside it are written out.

LOCKING ORDER ============= page lock -> client_obd_list_lock -> object lock(osc_object::oo_lock)

Definition at line 597 of file osc_cl_internal.h.

Field Documentation

unsigned int osc_extent::oe_fsync_wait

this extent should be written asap and someone may wait for the write to finish.

This bit is usually set along with urgent if the extent was CACHE state. fsync_wait extent can't be merged because new extent region may exceed fsync range.

Definition at line 611 of file osc_cl_internal.h.

unsigned int osc_extent::oe_grants

how many grants allocated for this extent.

Grant allocated for this extent. There is no grant allocated for reading extents and sync write extents.

Definition at line 638 of file osc_cl_internal.h.

pgoff_t osc_extent::oe_max_end

maximum ending index of this extent, this is limited by max_pages_per_rpc, lock extent and chunk size.

Definition at line 655 of file osc_cl_internal.h.

struct osc_page* osc_extent::oe_next_page [read]

Since an extent has to be written out in atomic, this is used to remember the next page need to be locked to write this extent out.

Not used right now.

Definition at line 647 of file osc_cl_internal.h.

unsigned int osc_extent::oe_no_merge

set if this extent has partial, sync pages.

Extents with partial page(s) can't merge with others in RPC

Definition at line 611 of file osc_cl_internal.h.

struct task_struct* osc_extent::oe_owner [read]

terminator of this extent.

Must be true if this extent is in IO.

Definition at line 662 of file osc_cl_internal.h.

struct list_head osc_extent::oe_pages [read]

list of pending oap pages.

Pages in this list are NOT sorted.

Definition at line 642 of file osc_cl_internal.h.

int osc_extent::oe_rc

return value of writeback.

If somebody is waiting for this extent, this value can be known by outside world.

Definition at line 603 of file osc_cl_internal.h.

pgoff_t osc_extent::oe_start

start and end index of this extent, include start and end themselves.

Page offset here is the page index of osc_pages. oe_start is used as keyword for red-black tree.

Definition at line 651 of file osc_cl_internal.h.

unsigned int osc_extent::oe_trunc_pending

an ACTIVE extent is going to be truncated, so when this extent is released, it will turn into TRUNC state instead of CACHE.

Definition at line 611 of file osc_cl_internal.h.

unsigned int osc_extent::oe_urgent

this extent should be written back asap.

set if one of pages is called by page WB daemon, or sync write or reading requests.

Definition at line 611 of file osc_cl_internal.h.

waitqueue - for those who want to be notified if this extent's state has changed.
